author: Gregory Alan Bailey

text: The graphics are enough to make one have to play this game. A lot of the places in this game are beautiful to look at and the music is catchy. The story is fine it has a somewhat tough battle system though, hopefully you're up for a good challenge.
author: Gregory Alan Bailey

text: At first i thought this game was trash, but after i really got into everyone's story this game became great!
author: Lord G

text:
I've always been afraid to start this game up due to all the backlash I've read about it over the years. I know for a fact that I'd be into the music and graphics, but my dislike for non-linear gameplay is my worry..
(Not against non-linear 'chapters' of a largely linear game, but i really don't get the point of a game being non-linear for the majority of its progression. Usually leads to a weak plot, lacking emotional drive.)
author: Goldsac

i have to agree....

author: Nethermir

text: One of the most unique RPGs Ive ever played, had an interesting but memorable soundtrack.  This track was one of the best in the game, always seemed like you were safe hearing this song...
author: Lee B

text:
Read "Saga Frontier" and had no idea what I was gonna' hear.

And then the music came on, and I remembered it all - put one of those creepy, 'where'd that come from' smiles on my face.
This game was something else.

text: I never owned this game, mostly because it garnered such mediocre reviews from pretty much every game site that I visited at the time.  The music is still nice though.  I have the PSF files for it.  I own the 2nd game and I absolutely love the music in that one.  Actually, the composer for the sequel is now Square Enix's lead composer and is working on scoring Final Fantasy XII: Masashi Hamauzu.
